title: Directive On The Preparation and Updating Of The Academic Calendar | Yönerge
text: Instruction No ISR-C270-01-V04 Effective Date 28-12-2004 Update Date 21-12-2023 Related Unit / Owner SR / Öğrenci Kaynakları Direktörlüğü Approved by BT / Board of Trustees Aim The main purpose of publishing this directive is to explain the general rules regarding the creation and announcement of the academic calendar, which includes the dates of applications, registrations, start and end of courses, exams and graduation for each academic year. Scope This directive covers Sabancı University students, academic members, staff and prospective students. Principle All students and employees are required to comply with the Academic Calendar prepared for the relevant academic year and approved by the Academic Council. Statutory Basis Definitions / Abbreviations AC: Academic Council is an authorized council to make decisions on academic matters and composed of the President, Vice-President, Faculty Deans and Academic Members IT: Information Technologies Non-Thesis Graduate Program CYSEC: Cyber Security Non-Thesis Graduate Program SL: School of Languages EMBA: Non-Thesis Graduate Program in Management for Directors Institute: Graduate School of Engineering and Natural Sciences, Graduate School of Social Sciences, Sabancı Graduate Business School ETM: Energy Technologies and Management Non-Thesis Graduate Program Faculty: Faculty of Engineering and Natural Sciences, Faculty of Art and Social Sciences, Sabancı Business School mART: Action Research and Transformation Non-Thesis Graduate Program MBA: Non-Thesis Graduate Program in Management MIF: Finance Non-Thesis Graduate Program SR: Student Resources Unit PBAN: Business Analytics Non-Thesis Graduate Program PMBA: Non-Thesis Graduate Program in Management for Professionals SU: Sabancı University UEC: University Education Committee DA: Data Analytics Non-Thesis Graduate Program YOK: Presidency of the Higher Education Council Regulations 1. PREPARATION AND ANNOUNCEMENT OF THE ACADEMIC CALENDAR 1.1. The academic calendar draft is prepared by the SR, the necessary arrangements, if any, are made in line with the opinions of the Faculties/Institutes/SL and other relevant units, and it is submitted to the UEC after taking the opinions of the Vice President responsible for Education. Following the opinions of the UEC, the final draft calendar is submitted for the AC approval by the SR. Following approval, the academic calendar comes into force. 1.2. The academic calendar is announced on SR internal and external websites in May at the latest for each academic year. Publishing the academic calendar on the internal and external web is carried out within the framework of the Academic Calendar Preparation and Update Procedure (PSR-C270-0101) . 1.3. It is essential that the students, academic and administrative units comply with the dates stated in the academic calendar. 1.4. The subjects included in the academic calendar and the approximate timing of these subjects according to semesters within an academic year have been given below. UPDATING THE ACADEMIC CALENDAR 2.1. The dates in the academic calendar cannot be changed unless there is a valid reason. However, if there is a justified and valid reason, the Faculty/Institute/SL or administrative units may forward their change suggestions to the Academic Council, along with the justification. 2.2. In case change suggestions are approved by the Academic Council, the academic calendar will be updated. 2.3. The update made in the academic calendar is published on SU internal and external web pages. Related Procedures Related Forms Related Form Links
